verses.verse: My <S%H1121>son,<s%> <S%H7181>attend<s%> unto my <S%H2451>wisdom,<s%> and <S%H5186>bow<s%> thine <S%H241>ear<s%> to my understanding: <S%H8394><s%>
That thou mayest <S%H8104>regard<s%> <S%H4209>discretion,<s%> and that thy <S%H8193>lips<s%> may <S%H5341>keep<s%> <S%H1847>knowledge.<s%>

For <S%H3588><s%> the <S%H8193>lips<s%> of a strange <S%H2114>woman<s%> <S%H5197>drop<s%> as a <S%H5317>honeycomb,<s%> and her <S%H2441>mouth<s%> is <S%H2509>smoother<s%> than <S%H4480>oil:<s%> <S%H8081><s%>
But her <S%H319>end<s%> is <S%H4751>bitter<s%> as <S%H3939>wormwood,<s%> <S%H2299>sharp<s%> as a <S%H6310>twoedged<s%> <S%H2719>sword.<s%>
Her <S%H7272>feet<s%> go <S%H3381>down<s%> to <S%H4194>death;<s%> her <S%H6806>steps<s%> take <S%H8551>hold<s%> on <S%H7585>hell.<s%>

Lest <S%H6435><s%> thou shouldest <S%H6424>ponder<s%> the <S%H734>path<s%> of <S%H2416>life,<s%> her <S%H4570>ways<s%> are <S%H5128>movable,<s%> that thou canst <S%H3808>not<s%> <S%H3045>know<s%> them.
Hear <S%H8085><s%> me <S%H6258>now<s%> therefore, O ye <S%H1121>children,<s%> and <S%H5493>depart<s%> <S%H408>not<s%> from the <S%H4480>words<s%> <S%H561><s%> of my <S%H6310>mouth.<s%>
Remove thy way <S%H7368>far<s%> <S%H1870><s%> <S%H4480>from<s%> <S%H5921><s%> her, and come not <S%H7126>nigh<s%> <S%H408><s%> <S%H413><s%> the <S%H6607>door<s%> of her house: <S%H1004><s%>
Lest <S%H6435><s%> thou <S%H5414>give<s%> thine <S%H1935>honor<s%> unto <S%H312>others,<s%> and thy <S%H8141>years<s%> unto the cruel: <S%H394><s%>
Lest <S%H6435><s%> <S%H2114>strangers<s%> be <S%H7646>filled<s%> with thy <S%H3581>wealth;<s%> and thy <S%H6089>labors<s%> be in the <S%H1004>house<s%> of a <S%H5237>stranger;<s%>
And thou <S%H5098>mourn<s%> at the <S%H319>last,<s%> when thy <S%H1320>flesh<s%> and thy <S%H7607>body<s%> are <S%H3615>consumed,<s%>
And <S%H559>say,<s%> <S%H349>How<s%> have I <S%H8130>hated<s%> <S%H4148>instruction,<s%> and my <S%H3820>heart<s%> <S%H5006>despised<s%> <S%H8433>reproof;<s%>
And have <S%H3808>not<s%> <S%H8085>obeyed<s%> the <S%H6963>voice<s%> of my <S%H3384>teachers,<s%> <S%H3808>nor<s%> <S%H5186>inclined<s%> mine <S%H241>ear<s%> to them that <S%H3925>instructed<s%> me!
I <S%H1961>was<s%> <S%H4592>almost<s%> in <S%H3605>all<s%> <S%H7451>evil<s%> in the <S%H8432>midst<s%> of the <S%H6951>congregation<s%> and <S%H5712>assembly.<s%>
Drink <S%H8354><s%> <S%H4325>waters<s%> out of thine own <S%H4480>cistern,<s%> <S%H953><s%> and running <S%H5140>waters<s%> out <S%H4480>of<s%> <S%H8432><s%> thine own <S%H875>well.<s%>
Let thy <S%H4599>fountains<s%> be <S%H6327>dispersed<s%> <S%H2351>abroad,<s%> and <S%H6388>rivers<s%> of <S%H4325>waters<s%> in the <S%H7339>streets.<s%>
Let them <S%H1961>be<s%> <S%H905>only<s%> thine own, and <S%H369>not<s%> <S%H2114>strangers'<s%> <S%H854>with<s%> thee.
Let thy <S%H4726>fountain<s%> <S%H1961>be<s%> <S%H1288>blessed:<s%> and <S%H8055>rejoice<s%> with the <S%H4480>wife<s%> <S%H802><s%> of thy <S%H5271>youth.<s%>

Let her be as the <S%H158>loving<s%> <S%H365>hind<s%> and <S%H2580>pleasant<s%> <S%H3280>roe;<s%> let her <S%H1717>breasts<s%> <S%H7301>satisfy<s%> thee at <S%H3605>all<s%> <S%H6256>times;<s%> and be thou <S%H7686>ravished<s%> <S%H8548>always<s%> with her <S%H160>love.<s%>
And <S%H4100>why<s%> wilt thou, my <S%H1121>son,<s%> be <S%H7686>ravished<s%> with a strange <S%H2114>woman,<s%> and <S%H2263>embrace<s%> the <S%H2436>bosom<s%> of a <S%H5237>stranger?<s%>

For <S%H3588><s%> the <S%H1870>ways<s%> of <S%H376>man<s%> are <S%H5227>before<s%> the <S%H5869>eyes<s%> of the <S%H3068>LORD,<s%> and he <S%H6424>pondereth<s%> <S%H3605>all<s%> his <S%H4570>goings.<s%>
His own <S%H5771>iniquities<s%> shall <S%H3920>take<s%> <S%H853><s%> the <S%H7563>wicked<s%> himself, and he shall be <S%H8551>holden<s%> with the <S%H2256>cords<s%> of his <S%H2403>sins.<s%>
He <S%H1931><s%> shall <S%H4191>die<s%> <S%H369>without<s%> <S%H4148>instruction;<s%> and in the <S%H7230>greatness<s%> of his <S%H200>folly<s%> he shall go <S%H7686>astray.<s%>
